intro: Agropyron littoreum, commonly known as sea barleygrass, is a perennial grass species native to coastal regions of the northern hemisphere. It thrives in saline and sandy environments, often found along shorelines and dunes. The plant has slender,丛生 stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh maritime conditions. Its flowering heads consist of small, spike-like clusters of bristle-like florets. Agropyron littoreum plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal soils and preventing erosion.
